subject: Sleep
title: Sleeping Pills Give Normal Sleep
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Sleeping Pills Give Normal Sleep.

hook.text: Sleeping pills make you unconscious. But unconsciousness is not the same as natural, restorative sleep.

buildup.text: Most prescription sleep medications, like benzodiazepines and Z-drugs, work by enhancing GABA activity.

discovery.text: They suppress deep sleep and REM, producing a sedated state that looks like sleep but lacks its restorative power.

twist.text: People on sleeping pills often report feeling rested because they don't remember the awakenings, not because they slept well.

climax.text: Long-term use is associated with increased mortality, cognitive impairment, and risk of dementia.

punchline.text: Sleeping pills create the illusion of sleep, not the real thing.

quiz.question: Why is sleep from sleeping pills not equivalent to natural sleep?
options: Pills produce identical sleep to natural sleep
They suppress deep sleep and REM, producing sedation not restoration
